intro: Heliconia aurantiaca, commonly known as the red heliconia, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the ginger family (Zingiberaceae) and is characterized by its striking, brightly colored inflorescences. The plant features long, narrow leaves that form a rosette pattern, and its flowers are clustered in a spiral arrangement. The bracts of the inflorescence are typically red or orange, giving the plant its vibrant appearance. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its aesthetic value and ability to thrive in warm, humid climates.
